Class TheaterDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • TheaterDriver

  • public class TheaterDriver
extends java.lang.Object
    The Main class for the Wonderful Movie Theater Program. This class handles all user input/output and coordinates all actions requested by the user.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.io.BufferedReader stdin
      Buffered Reader for handling of all user input/output.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TheaterDriver

        public TheaterDriver()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The program's main method. Prints a greeting message, creates a theater with auditoriums for the "Life" and "Logan" movies, and adds three customer lines to the theater. Then, runs the program loop.
        Parameters:
        args - program commandline arguments (not used)

      • createAuditorium

        public static Auditorium createAuditorium(java.lang.String movie)
        Constructs and returns an auditorium. Prompts the user for specifications for the auditorium that will play the given movie. The returned auditorium will match these specifications.
        Parameters:
        movie - the movie for which to construct the auditorium.
        Returns:
        the constructed auditorium.

      • close

        public static void close()
        Closes the Buffered Reader. Prints a goodbye message if the Buffered Reader closed successfully.

      • getInput

        public static java.lang.String getInput(java.lang.String prompt)
        Gets user input given a prompt message. Returns the user's response to the prompt. Note that a colon and space are appended to the given prompt. The prompt will show as follows: "prompt: "
        Parameters:
        prompt - the message to show to user to prompt for input.
        Returns:
        the user's response to the prompt.

      • getIntegerInput

        public static int getIntegerInput(java.lang.String prompt)
        Gets a user integer input given a prompt message. Returns the user's integer if it is strictly greater than zero. If a integer that is zero or less, or not an integer at all, is entered, the prompt will repeat.
        Parameters:
        prompt - the message to show to user to prompt for input.
        Returns:
        the user's integer response to the prompt.

      • getDoubleInput

        public static double getDoubleInput(java.lang.String prompt)
        Gets a user Double input given a prompt message. Returns the user's Double if it is strictly greater than zero. If a Double that is zero or less, or not an Double at all, is entered, the prompt will repeat.
        Parameters:
        prompt - the message to show to user to prompt for input.
        Returns:
        the user's Double response to the prompt.

      • askQuestion

        public static int askQuestion(java.lang.String prompt,
                              java.lang.String[] answers,
                              boolean showPossible)
        Asks the user a question. Prompts the user with the given prompt message and the given array of possible answers. If showPossible is true, prompt shows up as follows:

        prompt (answer1/answer2/.../answerN):

        Returns the index of the answer that was chosen. User answers that do not match exactly with one of the possible answers will be rejected. The prompt will keep running until a valid answer is given.

        Parameters:
        prompt - the question to show to the user to prompt for input.
        answers - the array of valid answers.
        showPossible - if true, will show all possible answers to user.
        Returns:
        the index of the user's answer.

      • askPolarQuestion

        public static boolean askPolarQuestion(java.lang.String prompt)
        Asks the user a yes-no question. Prompts the user with the given prompt message. The prompt shows up as follows:

        prompt (Y/N):

        The prompt will keep running until a case-sensitive 'Y' or 'N' are given. Returns true if the user input a 'Y'. Returns false if the use input a 'N'.

        Parameters:
        prompt - the yes-no question to show to the user.
        Returns:
        true if user answers with a 'Y'; false if user enters a 'N'.

      • getMenuInput

        public static java.lang.String getMenuInput()
        Prints the program menu and gets user's menu option. The program menu contains the following options:

        1. Customer(s) enter(s) Movie Theater.

        2. Customer buys ticket(s).

        3. Customer(s) leave(s) the theater.

        4. Display info about customers waiting for tickets.

        5. Display seating chart for Life Movie Theater.

        6. Display seating chart for Logan Movie Theater.

        7. Display number of tickets sold and total earnings.

        8. End the program.

        Returns the user's menu choice.

        Returns:
        the user's menu choice.

      • dispatchAction

        public static void dispatchAction(Theater theater,
                                  java.lang.String option)
        Triggers the appropriate action based on the given option. An action is performed on the given theater based on the given option.
        Parameters:
        theater - the theater on which to perform the action.
        option - this option dictates which action will be taken.

      • enterCustomer

        public static void enterCustomer(Theater theater)
        Enter a customer into the movie theater line. The user is prompted for the customer's name, the size of their party, and the movie they would like to see. The name must not match with any customer that is currently in line or watching a movie in the theater. If there is a name conflict, the user will be prompted for a new name until no conflict arises.The user is also asked if the customer has a child 11 or younger with them. The response to this question will dictate whether the customer may enter the express line or not. Once a customer is constructed based on the input data, they are entered into the given theater.
        Parameters:
        theater - the theater into which to place the new customer.

      • buyTickets

        public static void buyTickets(Theater theater)
        Serve a customer waiting in the theater line. If the given theater has not designated a line to serve next, the user will be prompted to select which line they would like to serve first. The customer in that line will be served by the given theater.
        Parameters:
        theater - the theater that will serve its customer.

      • removeCustomer

        public static void removeCustomer(Theater theater)
        Remove a customer from the theater. The user is prompted for the customer's name. All party members under the entered name will be removed from the theater. All records of the customer will be removed from the theater.
        Parameters:
        theater - the theater from which to remove a customer.

      • displayCustomerLine

        public static void displayCustomerLine(Theater theater)
        Display information about the customers waiting in line. Displays the customers in each of the given theater's lines.
        Parameters:
        theater - the theater for which to display customer lines.

      • displaySeating

        public static void displaySeating(Theater theater,
                                  java.lang.String movie)
        Displays an auditorium's seating chart. Displays the given theater's auditorium seating chart for the given movie.
        Parameters:
        theater - the theater for which to display the seating chart.
        movie - the movie auditorium for which to display the seating chart.

      • displayTicketInfo

        public static void displayTicketInfo(Theater theater)
        Displays information about the tickets sold. Displays the number of tickets sold for each movie as well as the total earnings for the given theater.
        Parameters:
        theater - the theater for which to display ticket information.

      • determineLineOrder

        public static void determineLineOrder(Theater theater)
        Asks the user which customer line they would like to serve first. The user may choose the express line or one of the two regular lines.
        Parameters:
        theater - the theater for which to determine line order.

      • serveCustomer

        public static void serveCustomer(Theater theater)
        Serve the next customer in line. Gets the customer to be served next in the given theater. Tries to seat the customer in their desired movie. If that movie is sold out, tries to find an alternate movie.
        Parameters:
        theater - the theater from which to serve the customer.

      • findAlternateMovie

        public static void findAlternateMovie(Theater theater,
                                      Customer customer)
        Tries to assign a movie to a customer that is not sold out. If a movie with enough seats to accomodate the customer is found, the user will be asked whether they want to see the alternate movie. If they deny or if all movies are sold out, the customer will be ejected from the theater.
        Parameters:
        theater - the theater in which to find an alternate movie.
        customer - the customer for which to find the movie.

      • seatCustomer

        public static void seatCustomer(Theater theater)
        Seat the customer into the auditorium playing their desired movie. Seats the next customer in line into their desired movie. Assumes the customer's movie will not be sold out.
        Parameters:
        theater - the theater in which to seat the customer.

      • ejectCustomer

        public static void ejectCustomer(Theater theater,
                                 java.lang.String name)
        Removes the next customer in line from the theater. The customer to be served next will not view any movie, or purchase any tickets. All record of them will be removed from the given theater.
        Parameters:
        theater - the theater from which to remove the customer.
        name - the customer's name.
